Title: the positive negative reaction

Howard: Morning.
We? What is this?
Continued on milk. If you’re tricking me into making my own breakfast, it didn’t work for my mom, and it won’t work for you. Are. We are. See spoons for more.
Are you serious?
Are you sure?
Oh, my God. This is incredible. We’re gonna be parents? We’re gonna get to board planes first. Finally gonna get to see what’s in that family bathroom at the mall.
It is crazy. Oh. I mean, how do you prepare for something like this? I’m not even sure I’ve held a baby before.

But how’s this all gonna work? Do we get a nanny? I mean, can we afford a nanny? And if we can, we can’t get a pretty one, ’cause it’ll wreck our marriage. We can’t get an ugly one, ’cause it’ll scare the kid.

Are we in a good school district? You’re Catholic, I’m Jewish. What religion do we raise it? And if it’s a boy, do we get him circumcised? People say it’s barbaric, but if we don’t, it looks like a pig in a blanket.
How’s it gonna be okay? Look at me, I’m a mess. And that means this baby’s gonna be half a mess. And that’s even before we screw it up with our cut-rate moderately attractive nanny.
Yeah, um, in a minute. I actually need to tell you guys something.
I’m, uh, uh, gonna be a father.
I shouldn’t be raising a kid. I don’t even eat my own vegetables.
And then there’s this nose. I mean, what if he looks like me? Or worse, what if she looks like me?
Oh, my God, and do you have any idea how expensive having a kid is?
A million dollars? God, it’s like my nuts just kicked me in the nuts. That’s it, I got to start earning more money right now.
This isn’t a joke.
You’re right, it is, I’m just a little overwhelmed right now.
Well, look at this. I bet whoever invented tiny umbrellas doesn’t have to worry about money. He can have all the kids he wants.
If I’m gonna have any chance of raising this kid, I need to come up with a big idea to make some money.
That’s easy for you to say. You and Sheldon already came up with your superfluid helium model.
Okay, how about this for an invention, slightly bigger cocktail umbrellas.
I don’t know, all Apple does is change the size of things and we keep buying them.
Maybe that’s an idea, guidance systems for drunk people.
Hey. In your supercooled helium experiments, did you create quantum vortices?
Well, if you made a guidance system, couldn’t you use those vortices as a gyroscope?
And since it’s in a quantum state, it would maintain an infinite persistence.
You think so?
I’m not finding anything either.
Damn. What is it?
If this is a viable thing, we could get a patent and license it to companies that make guidance systems.
Maybe you’re right.
Thank you, Sheldon.
Thank you.
I’m really glad you’re here. Can we talk?
I’m sorry I freaked out this morning. I want you to know I’m done being scared.
Thank God, ’cause I was lying, you might not have to wait nine months to see someone soil their pants. But I’m also really excited. I mean it.
I love you. Mmm. And I’m not just saying that because your breasts are gonna get bigger.

I’d like to dedicate my last song of the evening to my wife, best friend, and now the mother of our child. I love you, Bernie. (Singing) Havin’ my baby, what a lovely way of sayin’ how much you love me. Havin’ my baby, what a lovely way of sayin’ what you’re thinkin’ of me.
Thank you, Pasadena. Good night.
Bernadette: Morning.
I don’t know. Maybe it says something on the back.
What could it be? We are Groot? We are the champions? We are family? I got all my sisters with me?
Yeah.
Pretty positive. That’s a joke, because the pregnancy test says…
I know, it’s crazy.
Oh, it’s okay, you’ll figure it out.
I don’t know, Howie.
Calm down, it’s gonna be okay.
So, I’m glad you guys are here. There’s something I want to share with you. Howie and I are going to…
I’m pregnant.
Yeah, it’s all real exciting.

I am. Of-of course I am. I’m, I’m sure it’s just the hormones. But it’s weird, Howie’s the one who’s been talking about having kids for years, and I was all excited to tell him because I thought he’d be thrilled, but then he started to flip out and now this feels like a bad idea and I’m gonna get fat.
Easy for you to say, skinny bitch. Sorry, hormones.
You’re probably right. After we talked about it, he started to calm down.
Where?
Can’t drink.
Doctor said I can’t have sushi.

Kind of on Sheldon’s bed.

You guys can go in if you want.
That sounds fun.
How is that a drunk text?
Sure.
It’s okay to be nervous. I am, too.
Me, too.
I appreciate this, but you really…

Hey.

Hey, you know what we should do?
Go out and celebrate. But not your worst idea.
And his tight little pants that somehow did not make him sterile.
There’s no reason you can’t.

Uh, these are strong, you should slow down.

I’d enjoy that.
I’m telling you, you got this.

You want it, you got it, oh, you want it, baby you got it
Probably ’cause you got to see your man up there rockin’ the mic.
Oh. That was really an asthma attack. I just sold it.
Me, too. So, you ever think about it?
I think we’d make amazing parents.

Well, you be sure to let us know when you win the Nobel Prize for boysenberry.
Hello.
Oh, no.

Oh, dear lord, Penny’s pregnant, too?
Oh, really? Okay, well, would a baby have to shave once every 11 days?
I guess we’ll call this a draw.

And can keep a small portion of their heads dry.
